items.content:
Welkom op de pagina Introductie HAS Services.

Dit is de Engelse versie voor locatie Venlo.

- Klik hier voor de Nederlandse versie voor locatie Den Bosch

- Klik hier voor de Nederlandse versie voor locatie Venlo

Welcome on the page Introduction HAS Services.

This is the English version for location Venlo

- Click here for the English version, location Den Bosch

Welcome to the Introduction to HAS Services!
After following this Introduction, you will know what facilities are made available by HAS Services, and you will be able to start using them straight away!

The HAS Services team supports the HAS students and employees in realising their goals:
"We help you do it!"

HAS Services consists of the departments IT Services, Facility Services and Information Services. The HAS Services team also includes professionals in the field of system and network management, sustainability and information management.

We try to ensure our services meet the needs of our users as much as possible. Is there anything we have overlooked? Let us know!

This Introduction includes exercises and assignments. The assignments are marked in red. These need to be carried out immediately. If you change anything (e.g. a password), then it will be changed in reality!

If you experience any issues during one of the assignments, please continue this course and contact HAS Services by submitting a ticket at the ServicePoint at a later point in time.
​​

NB: Because this E-learning platform still does not meet all the requirements, some words are not translated in English:

  • aantal vragen = number of questions
  • controleer antwoord = check answer
  • fout = wrong
  • goed = correct
  • introductie = introduction
  • oefening = exercise
  • resultaat = result
  • titel = title
  • vorige = back
  • volgende = next
  • voortgang = progress
  • vraag = question

HAS Services is responsible for example for workplace support, audio-visual equipment, telephones, applications, the network, cleaning, catering, furniture, garbage disposal and event support.
If you have a question about any of the above, or on any other issue regarding the facilities in and around the HAS buildings, you can contact one of our support desks:

Venlo:
- Reception desk;
- Intranet: SelfService desk (IT).

At the reception you can also reserve and borrow equiment (for example videocameras and beamers) and areas.


Den Bosch:
- the Service desk near the main entrance in the Atrium;
- Email: hasservices@has.nl;
- Intranet: SelfService desk (IT);
- telephone: 088-8903666.

The responsibilities of the Information Services team include:

  • all questions regarding literature research, search terms, sources, references and copyright;
  • help and advice regarding searching for, finding, obtaining, processing and sharing information;
  • information (physical and digital), geared towards the domains of the various study programmes, made easily accessible (Greeni).

Questions about these issues can be forwarded to:

  • the reception;
  • telephone: 088-8903300;
  • Email: informationservices@has.nl


On Mondays there is an information specialist available for questions about searching for, processing and sharing information.

All HAS students are allowed to use the facilities HAS provides. To make sure everyone is able to use them, the following agreements apply:

- Use the facilities with care;
- Don't eat or drink in the classrooms.

Each student at the HAS has their own HAS account, in order to be able to use the HAS network.
You have received an email containing the details of your HAS account (username and password).

Your HAS account can be used for most of the facilities within the HAS.
There are a few exceptions:
- Blackboard;
- Starleaf;
- Greeni.

The log in details of your HAS account are used for example for accessing your webmail and for Intranet. As mentioned earlier, Blackboard, Starleaf and Greeni are exceptions.

You can change the password for your HAS account at the site: https://password.has.nl.

Change your password now, via one of the above methods and using the instructions below:

  • Enter in the first field Studentnumber@has.nl;
  • Enter in the second field your current password
  • Enter 2 times the new password. The requirements of the password are: a minimum of 8 characters, 1 uppercase and 1 lowercase alphabetical characteretter and a number.
  • Press 'Submit' to set your new password.

Blackboard is the digital learning environment at HAS.

You can access Blackboard using one of the following methods:
- hao.blackboard.nl (click 'Logon' on the right upperside of the screen for English);
- Intranet in the favories menu (star in top right corner) > 'Blackboard'.

The login details for Blackboard are different to the login details for your HAS account.
The email you received with your general login details also contains the login details for Blackboard.

Change your password for Blackboard now by following the instructions in this manual.

Skype for Business is a videoconferencing sollution wich can be used to have a conversation without the need to travel.

This is how you can get access to Skype for Business:

Skype for Business is a part of the Office 365 Suite (Office 2016), which you can install with your HAS account on 5 of your personal devices. Go to https://portal.office.com en log on with your HAS account. On the main page, click on 'Install Software' and choose 'Office 2016'.

To get more information about Skype for Business, find the manuals here

Greeni (the library for 'green' applied university studies) is the joint website of the digital libraries of Aeres University of Applied Sciences, HAS University of Applied Sciences and Van Hall Larenstein. In addition to a catalogue, with menu functions such as extending your borrowing period and reserving a book, you'll also find internet sources, databases and digital magazines that have been specially selected for you. You'll also find everything about information skills (searching, finding and using information), copyright and more.

You can access Greeni as follows:
Go to the login page of HAS University of Applied Sciences, choose Greeni and login with your HAS account.

Now apply for a password for 'My Greeni':

Please note, it's possible that this take a while, if this is the case, please continue with the next step (2.5 practice).
- Click on 'Login My Greeni';
- Under 'Borrower number' enter your student number;
- Click on 'Click here and the system will send you an e-mail'.
(You will then receive a password in your HAS mailbox.)

Lean Library

Another way to get remote access to the databases, e-journals and e-books that are licensed for use by the library is Library access (lean Library browser extension)

Now install the Lean Library browser extension on your own device:

The option we recommend, works via a so-called extension in Google Chrome, Firefox, Apple Safari or Opera. If you use other browsers, such as Internet Explorer or Edge, it is worth considering using one of the browsers mentioned above, at least during searching for literature (If you really do not want this, use one or more of the options 2 to 4 below).

  • To install the extension, click here.
  • Click on Download for Google Chrome, Firefox, Apple Safari or Opera (your browser will be recognized automatically).
  • Click on Add.
  • Under Select your library choose your institution and after that click on Save.

On the top right of your browser you now see the little Lean Library icon. From now the extension checks during browsing whether you're on a website that is licensed by your institution or not and whether you're on campus or off campus (i.e. at home). Depending on the website and your location a pop-up screen can be shown that says whether you have access or not. When you're off campus, you will be asked to log in with your

institutional account (once per browser session) or you will see a user name and/or password with which you can log in on that particular website. When you don't have access to the licensed content, the icon of the extension is grey; when you do have access, the icon is green.

prompt.body: Which application does not use your HAS-account?

content.body:
Blackboard requires a separate account and cannot be used with your HAS-account.
The required credentials are mentioned in the letter you have received.
You can use your HAS-account to get access to the webmail.
You can use your HAS-account to get access to the intranet.
You can use your HAS-account to get access to Myprint.

prompt.body: How can you change your Blackboard password?

content.body: Via Personal Information after you have logged in to Blackboard.
The credentials for blackboard are not connected to your HAS-account, so changing your HAS-account password will not change your Blackboard password.
You cannot change this password yourself.
This is not true, you can change your Blackboard password by following this instruction.

prompt.body: What is Skype for Business?
How can you obtain a password for Greeni?

content.body: You can submit a request through "My Greeni".
This application makes use of your HAS-account, so there is no need to obtain a separate password for this.
You can create a new account on the Greeni website.

heading.content: Module 3: How to use the Wireless network (Wi-Fi)?

items.content:
Inside HAS premises you can use the Wi-Fi network: Eduroam.
Eduroam (education roaming) enables you to use the HAS Wi-Fi network safely.
You can use your HAS account to access the Eduroam network at other academic
and research institutes around the world.

Now use your mobile device(s) to connect to Eduroam.
Choose which of the operating systems below applies to your device(s):

Attention, if it does not work, please continue with the next step (3.2 Practice)
If you experience problems, you can contact IT Services at a later time about this issue.

- Microsoft Windows 7;
- Microsoft Windows 8 / 8.1;
- Windows 10;
- Google Android;
- Apple iOS;
- Windows Phone.

Important!
Your connection to Eduroam is linked to your HAS account. If you change your password for your HAS account, you will also need to change your password in your Eduroam settings.

prompt.body: Which networks you can use after you have setup eduroam?

content.body: all networks in the close range of HAS

prompt.body:
True or false:

If you change your password for your HAS account, you will also need to change your password in your Eduroam settings.

content.body: Your connection with Eduroam is linked to your HAS account. If you change your password for your HAS account, you will also need to change your password in your Eduroam settings.

items.content:
As a HAS student you have access to various parts of Microsoft Office, including Word, Excel, ​​ PowerPoint and OneDrive.

If you log in to Office 365 with your HAS account, you will have access, for example, to your webmail, personal files (OneDrive) and the HAS-kennisplein (cooperation).
You log in via: http://webmail.has.nl

You can also access your HAS mail, agenda and contacts on your mobile devices. You can find how to do this in this manual on Intranet.

The following applies regarding the use of email:
- Do not send mails to the entire HAS population unless absolutely necessary, and only in consultation with your study programme secretary. When you send an email to a group of people, always use the BCC option.
- Use CC and BCC sparingly. Think in advance who you want to mail, so your email won't be seen as spam. This also applies to answering mails sent to multiple people. Is it really necessary to send your reply to everyone in the original mail, or is just the sender sufficient?

You can send a maximum of 35 MB per mail, internally and externally. It is possible that the receiver can't receive files of that size and so your mail may bounce.

Tip!
If you get sent a document via the mail, make sure you save it before you start working in it! Otherwise the document will be saved as a temporary file and this makes it hard to retrieve!

As a HAS student, you can also use the Microsoft Imagine Academy. It helps you work productively with Microsoft Office programmes and other software tools that are useful for lots of jobs and other future activities you may find yourself doing.

You can only start using Microsoft Imagine Academy after your account has been activated. You will automatically receive a mail with instructions on how to activate your account.

Please note: If you have not yet received this activation e-mail, you are unable to login to the Imagine Academy. The activation e-mail will be sent to you shortly.

After activating your account, you can access Microsoft Imagine Academy via this link. Log in using your HAS account details.

Alluris is the student progress system. It enables you to check your results wherever and whenever you want. In addition, you can apply for exam resits yourself via Alluris.
Student Affairs is responsible for maintaining Alluris. You can, therefore, only address any questions related to Alluris to the Student Affairs team.
You will find more information about Alluris on Intranet.

In addition, there is also the schedule system. Here, you can see the modules that you are enrolled for, for example. Student Affairs is also responsible for maintaining the schedule system. You should, therefore, address any questions to the Student Affairs team. You will find more information about the participation system on Intranet.

prompt.body:
True or false:

You may not send e-mails to the entire HAS population.

content.body: Do not send mails to the entire HAS population unless absolutely necessary, and only in consultation with your study programme secretary.
Do not send mails to the entire HAS population unless absolutely necessary, and only in consultation with your study programme secretary.

prompt.body: What is the limit per mail you can send?

content.body: 35 MB per mail, internally and externally

prompt.body:
What is the purpose of Microsoft Imagine Academy?
(several answers possible)
Who do you need to contact if you have questions about Alluris?

heading.content: Module 5: Where can I save my files?

items.content:
Files can be saved to various locations:
- HAS temporary files
- OneDrive
- USB-stick/external hard drive;
- CD/DVD.

Lecturers have the option of making documents accessible to students.
They can do this via Blackboard or by placing them on the site 'HAS temporary files'.
How the site is used, varies per study programme. Your lecturers will explain how it is used for your study programme.

As a student, you can only read the documents on the site. You can't save any documents there yourself.

You can access the site via the link: https://haskennisplein.sharepoint.com/sites/storage/, also possible from home.

OneDrive is the online storage service from Microsoft. It is comparable to services such as Google Drive and Dropbox. The files are saved 'in the cloud'.

You can access OneDrive via 'HAS Kennisplein' with your HAS account. To go there, use the link https://kennisplein.has.nl.

On the page, click 'My Documents':

You can use OneDrive for storing personal work files and to easely share or colaborate on files/documents. There is an automatic back-up of files, when accidentaly deleting a document you can restore it with the recycle bin.

For more information about using OneDrive, go to HAS Kennisplein and click on the tile 'Info HAS Kennisplein'

You can also save your documents on an external device such as a USB stick. It is important to realise how vulnerable this medium is. It is often impossible to retrieve files from a broken USB stick. Each year we also find countless USB sticks. So it's also a medium that is often forgotten. That's why we advise you to always have a back-up of any documents you have on external devices.

prompt.body:
True or false:

As a student you can store files on the site 'HAS temporary files'.

content.body: Students have "read-only" rights on that site. Teachers have "read" and "write" access to this site.
Students have "read-only" rights on that site. Teachers have "read" and "write" access to this site.

prompt.body:
True or false

Onedrive is being backed up.

heading.content: Module 6: How do I use the multifunctionals (MFCs)?

items.content:
Throughout the HAS premises are MFCs. You can use these devices to scan, print and copy, in black-white and in colour.

In order to use the MFCs you need to log in with your HAS account and your account needs to have sufficient credit on it.

You can add credit to your account via the MyPrint website. You can add €10, €20 or €30.
This manual describes how you can add credit to your account.

The charges for printing and copying are:

A4 black-white €0,05
A4 colour €0,15
A3 black-white €0,07
A3 colour €0,30


At the reception you can borrow Rabobank scanners and ABN Amro e.dentifiers so you can make a payment electronically (in exchange for your student card).

heading.content: 6.2 Installing a printer on your own laptop

items.content:
You can install the printer on your own laptop, so you have access to all the printing functionalities of the HAS printers.

See the manuals below how to install the printerdrivers:

Manual for Windows - Installation file for Windows

Manual for MacOSX - Installation file for MacOSX

Install the HAS-printer on your laptop.

If you send something to the printer from a HAS computer, the standard settings are double-sided and black and white. If you don't want this, then you need to change these in the settings before you send your document to the printer. These settings can't be changed later at the printer!
Most of the settings can be changed immediately prior to clicking on the 'print' option, but a few things, such as colour, can be changed under 'Printer properties'.

A useful option is that you can have your document stapled free-of-charge by the MFC.
You do need to ask for this on your own laptop, before sending the document to the printer! This is a useful option and makes your document look neater.

If you want to scan a document, you have to choose 'scan-to-me' before you log in on the MFC.


Although scanning is free, you do need at least €0.10 credit on your account in order to be able to use the service. You also need to have at least €0.10 on your account in order to be able to print something. In other words, if you want to print something worth €0.05, you still need to have €0.10 on your account.

The scans are sent to your HAS email address. (If you place the object on the glass plate, you still need to press # to actually send the scan to your email!)

prompt.body: How can you top up your credit for the MFCs?

content.body: You can top up your credit via the MyPrint website.
You can top up your credit at the Servicedesk in the Atrium.
You can top up your credit at any MFC.

prompt.body: Where do you specify if you want to print your document in colour?

content.body: The settings can be changed under 'Printer properties' prior to submitting the printjob.
The settings can be changed at the MFC.

prompt.body: How many credit do you need if you want to use the MFC for scanjob?

content.body: Although scanning is free, you do need at least €0.10 credit on your account in order to be able to use the service.
No credit required, scanning is free of charge.

heading.content: Module 7: Where can I find information?

items.content:
As you have noticed during this instruction training, lots of information can be found on Intranet.
In addition, lots of information is also provided on the NarrowCasting screens throughout the building.

You can find information for HAS students and employees on Intranet. This information is only accessible to people with a HAS account.

If you start Internet Explorer or Mozilla Firefox on a HAS computer, Intranet is automatically opened as the homepage (you will be logged in automatically, because you are logged in on a HAS computer).
Outside of the HAS, or on your own laptop, you can access Intranet via https://haskennisplein.sharepoint.com/sites/wis You then log in using your HAS account to gain access to the Intranet.

In the top menu you can see, among other things, the study programmes. Below this you will find per location, Den Bosch and Venlo, the study programs. The information here about your study programme, is provided by the secretary of your study programme. If you want to place anything here, you should ask the study programme secretary.

You will find the timetable and your grades on the green tile 'TimeTables'. You can import your timetable into your calendar in Outlook. The manual for this is also on the Intranet page. If you come across any problems with this, you can contact IT Services.

As mentioned previously, questions about Alluris and the participation system can be forwarded to Student Affairs. You should send any questions about the timetable to Schedule Affairs.

You can also make reservations via the Intranet. As a student, you can reserve areas and equipment (for example video cameras, voice recorders and beamers). Reserving equipment is done via Intranet, with the green tile 'Service Point'. Collecting and returning the equipment is done at the Servicedesk in the Atrium.

Throughout the HAS premises you will see NarrowCasting screens. These screens provide information of interest to everyone visiting HAS, so not only for students and employees.

Examples of information on the screens:
- Announcements regarding HAS related events;
- Messages from HAS in-house companies (for example catering and the bookstore);
- non-commercial/ideological messages (from former students or former employees);
- messages with important breaking news or current affairs.

You can also have information placed on the NarrowCasting screens. Details of the criteria the message needs to meet are on Intranet.

prompt.body: Who can access the Intranet?

content.body: This Intranet is only accessible to people with a HAS account.

prompt.body:
True or false:
You can import your schedule in Outlook.

content.body: You can find instructions how to do this on the Intranet.

prompt.body: What kind of information will not be displayed on the narrowcasting screens?

content.body: NS train times from Den Bosch station
Messages with important breaking news or current affairs

items.content:
SURFspot is the non-profit ICT webstore with special discounts on software, cloud services and hardware, exclusive to students and employees in the Dutch higher education sector.

Via SURFspot you can buy software, cloud solutions or hardware for the lowest prices. You can choose from over 250 articles from renowned suppliers such as Adobe, Norton, McAfee and Microsoft. Which products and prices you see in the webstore depends on the HAS SURFmarket. HAS pays for most of the licences for home-use. This is one of the reasons why SURFspot is able offer products at such a low price. The discount can be up to 90% compared to the recommended selling price. I.e., really smart deals for education.

In the webstore, you order any software or cloud service you need, for example, easily. You will often receive a link to download the software immediately, or to gain access to the cloud service. And if you can't figure it out, an expert employee of the customer services will help you out. Legal software for an affordable price, that's what you find at SURFspot.

Log in to SURFspot:
- Go to www.surfspot.nl
- Click on Mijn SURFspot
- Choose 'HAS Hogeschool' from the list
- Log in with your HAS account


Please note, do not purchase Office software via Surfspot. You can download the Office suite for free via your HAS-account.

This is a short questionnaire about the course you just took.

Goodluck !

heading.content: Thank you for participating in the digital introduction HAS Services

items.content:
Feedback?

We would like to thank you for your attention!

If you have any feedback or improvements for us, let us know!

Here you can find the source list, which contains the sources that are used for the pictures in this introduction.
The numbering in this document is correspondend to the numbering of the modules.
